contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Promontory Point}} [[Image:UTMap-doton-PromontoryPoint.PNG|right|Location of Promontory Point, Utah]] [[File:Great Salt Lake Map.jpg|thumb|Promontory Peninsula with the Lucin Cutoff crossing the end of the peninsula]] '''Promontory Point''' is the [[Headlands and bays|cape]] or southernmost point of the [[peninsula]] formed where the [[Promontory Mountains]] project into the northern [[Great Salt Lake]] at {{coord|41|12|18|N|112|25|43|W|}} in [[Box Elder County]], [[Utah]], with an [[elevation]] of {{convert|4297|ft}} above [[sea level]].<ref>{{Cite GNIS|1431483|Promontory Point (cape)}}</ref><ref name=Point>''Promontory Point, Utah,'' 7.5 Minute Quadrangle, USGS, 1991 </ref> It is {{convert|4.75|km}} northwest of the west end of [[Fremont Island]] in [[Weber County, Utah|Weber County]].<ref name=Point/> Promontory Point also refers to the location {{coord|41|13|20|N|112|24|38|W|}}<ref>{{Cite GNIS|1431484|Promontory Point (locale)}}</ref> where the [[Lucin Cutoff]] intersects the east coast of the peninsula, {{Convert|1.7|mi}} northeast of the cape. The Lucerne Cutoff passes {{convert|1250|ft}} north of the cape and continues west {{convert|6.4|mi}} to Saline where the cutoff leaves the peninsula.<ref name=Point/> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Cliffs of the United States]] [[Category:Great Salt Lake]] [[Category:Headlands of the United States]] [[Category:Landforms of Box Elder County, Utah]] [[de:Promontory Point]]
